description: Marsden +â€Ž -ia, from the genus name, named after William Marsden (orientalist).

entries.meaning: (botany) Any of the genus Marsdenia of apocynaceous plants.
examples: The odour of the 'Madagascar chaplet-flower' came floating out, mingled with the fragrant scents of the marsdenias, and the sloping shelves were one mass of varied bloom.
